properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Rabbitohs at BlueBet Stadium. Kick-off from 7:50pm and full-time approx. 9:15pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as fans travel to the stadium on Thursday evening.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Macarthur FC from 5pm to 7pm approx at Glenn Willow Stadium, Mudgee.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as soccer fans travel to and from the game on Friday afternoon particularly heavy along Ulan Rd, Short St and Market St. 

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking.

properties.publicTransport: Race tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Autumn Carnival - Ladies Day - First race 12:25pm. Last race 6pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Titans at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Kick-off from 6:15pm and full-time approx. 8:15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close ahead of kick-off including Jubilee Avenue, Park Street and English Street. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.otherAdvice:
Traffic may be heavier than usual approaching Taronga Zoo while the Twilight at Taronga Summer Concert Series is running from Friday 10 February to Saturday 11 March. Concerts start from 5.30pm each night, finishing around 9.30pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the Zoo including Military Rd, Bradleys Head Rd, Athol Wharf Rd and Whiting Beach Rd.

Traffic controllers will be on site managing parking and traffic flow along Bradleys Head Rd at the Zoo car park.

Palm Tree Music Festival at Sydney Showground from 7pm to 11pm.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park may be closed for the events. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before to secure a space as parking will fill quickly.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Route 308 buses will be diverting around Redfern St while it's closed for the event. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Sydney Streets event on Redfern St. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Redfern St will be closed between Regent St and Chalmers St in both directions from 9am until 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Renwick St, George St and Glover St will also be closed during this time.
  • Pitt St will remain open to allow traffic to cross Redfern St.
  • Motorists travelling west will be detoured via Chalmers St, Cleveland St and Regent St. Motorists travelling east will be detoured via Regent St, Botany Rd and Raglan St.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Redfern St, George St and Renwick St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee apply

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

REDFERN

FROM 9AM TO 11:30PM

  • Redfern St between Regent St and Chalmers St
  • Renwick St 1 between Turner St and Redfern St
  • Renwick St 1 between Redfern St and Wells St
  • George St 1 between Turner St and Redfern St
  • George St 1 between Wells St and Turner St

Note: Pitt St will remain open in both directions crossing Redfern St


SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the roads below unless stated otherwise. Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.title: Road closures and special event clearways

webLinks.linkText: TfNSW Interactive clearway and road closure map

properties.publicTransport:
Public transport is included in attendees’ tickets to the event, even if you’re travelling from Sydney.

Extra train, bus, ferry and light rail services scheduled to help visitors get to and from the event. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

Unlike the 2019 Newcastle 500, a park and ride option from Broadmeadow (McDonald Jones Stadium) to the circuit will not be available this year.
properties.otherAdvice:
More than 150,000 people are expected to attend the Supercars Newcastle 500 around the Newcastle East Foreshore from Friday 10 to Sunday 12 March.

Delays are expected on the M1 Motorway and Pacific Hwy on approach to Newcastle as crowds arrive and leave, particularly on Saturday and Sunday mornings. Changed traffic conditions will be in effect on roads inside and outside the circuit for the 3-day event. 

ROAD CLOSURES, LOCAL ACCESS AND PARKING RESTRICTIONS

  • From 7am Tuesday 28 February to 5pm Friday 17 March: closure of Warf Road between Nobbys Road to Pasha Way
  •  From 4am Sunday 5 to 6am Tuesday 14 March: roads east of Watt St along the racetrack will operate under one-way traffic conditions. Parking along the racing circuit is strictly prohibited
  • From 7am Wednesday 8 March to 6pm Monday 13 March: Closure of Wharf Road between Argyle Street and Watt Street 
  •  From 5am Sunday 5 March to 11pm Tuesday 14 March: Closure of Reserve Road/Watt Street between York Drive and James Fletcher Hospital 
  •  From 7am to 7pm Thursday 9 March, 7am to 10pm Friday 10 March, 7am to 11pm Saturday 11 March and 7am to 7pm Sunday 12 March and Monday 13 March: Closure of Hunter Street and Scott Street (eastbound) between Darby Street and Murray Avenue
  • From 7am to 7pm daily from Friday 10 to Sunday 12 March: Westbound lanes of Scott Street closed from Watt Street to Wolfe Street, Newcomen Street north of Hunter Street Mall and Bolton Street between King and Scott Streets
  • From 7am to 7pm daily Friday 10, Saturday 11 and Sunday 12 March: Church Street closed between Newcomen and Watt Streets
  •  From 7am to 7pm each day on Saturday 11 and Sunday 12 March: Closure of roads north of King Street including sections of Brown, Perkins, Thorn and Newcomen Streets
  • From 7am to 7pm daily Friday 10 to Sunday 12 March: all roads east of Bolton Street will close. You cannot drive your vehicle on roads in the circuit during race hours. Outside of race hours access in and out of the circuit across Watt Street is via King Street (entry only) and Scott Street (exit only) for Official Supercars Vehicle Access Passholders or rideshare vehicles only. 

Please note: Traffic controllers will be on-site to permit residents through the closure points for access to properties on Scott Street and nearby roads. Access properties on Scott Street between Newcomen Street and Brown Street via Wolfe Street or Newcomen Street from King Street. Access properties on Scott Street between Watt Street and Newcomen Street via Bolton Street from King Street. 

Special event clearways are in place for track construction and will continue for the event weekend, starting from 5am Friday 10 March and run until 11pm Sunday 12 March 2023. Motorists are advised to check signs before parking as vehicles in special event clearways will be towed and fines apply.

An interactive road closure and clearway map is available in the links.

What are special event clearways?

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply to all vehicles, including residents with local parking permits and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. They are put in place to provide extra road space for the event and to remove vehicles from the precinct for public safety. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

FIND OUT MORE

For event enquiries contact community@supercars.com or call 02 8346 2676.

roads.mainStreet: Wharf Road, Hunter Street, Scott Street, King Street

properties.otherAdvice:
The Australian Alpine Ascent will consist with two days of Trail Running events, within the Kosciuszko National Park.

Speed reductions will be in place on Kosciuszko Road around Perisher resort and Charlotte Pass. Motorists should follow the directions of traffic control, reduce speed and drive with caution when in the area.

Russell Peters at Qudos Bank Arena. Start 8:30pm. Finish approx 11pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run from local areas. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Ramadan Night markets on Haldon St from Tuesday 21 March to Thursday 20 April from 5pm to 3am nightly.

Heavy traffic is expected in the area, particularly on Thursday – Sunday nights during the festival.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra time as roads will be closed around Lakemba Station and detours will be in place.

The following road closures will be in place from 4pm to 3am each night from Tuesday 21 March to Thursday 20 April:

  • Haldon St between Railway Pde and The Boulevarde
  • Haldon St between 178 Haldon St and Grace Ave
  • The Boulevarde between Croydon St and Oneata Ln
  • The Boulevarde between Quigg St and Haldon St
  • Gillies St between Quigg St and Haldon St
  • Oneata St between Croydon St Haldon St

Follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police on site.
properties.diversions:
Southbound traffic on Haldon St north of the railway line will be detoured using Railway Pde, Moreton St, The Blvd, Quigg St, Grace Ave and Haldon St to Canterbury Rd.

Northbound traffic on Haldon St will be detoured using Grace Ave, Quigg St, The Blvd and Moreton St to Lakemba St.

Eastbound traffic on The Blvd west of Haldon St will be detoured using Croydon St to Canterbury Rd.

Westbound traffic on The Blvd east of Haldon St will be detoured using Quigg St, Grace Ave andHaldon St to Canterbury Rd.

properties.otherAdvice:
The Moruya Mardi Gras Street Parade will take place today from 1pm to 3pm.

Intermittent closures may cause delays on the Princes Highway whilst the march crosses the Highway at Church St. Exercise caution as high pedestrian activity is expected.

properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual Newcastle Show at Newcastle Showground in Broadmeadow from 9am to 10pm on Friday and Saturday and from 9am to 5pm on Sunday.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than normal on Griffiths Rd, Turton and Lambton Rd, particularly during Friday afternoon peak.

Across the weekend motorists should allow extra travel time, follow directions from traffic control on site and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads.

A-League: Macarthur FC v Brisbane Roar at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Start from 3pm, finish approx 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
Wests Tigers v Titans at Leichhardt Oval. Kick off from 6:15pm and full time around 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event.

Mary St may be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place.

Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney - Sydney Streets event on Glebe Point Rd. The event runs from 11am until 10pm.

  • Glebe Point Rd will be closed between Broadway and St Johns Rd from 9am to 10:30pm.
  • Sections of Norton St, Mitchell St, Cowper St, Derwent Ln, Derby Pl and Francis St will also be closed during this time.
  • Motorists can detour around the closures via St Johns Rd and Derwent St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 10:30pm on sections of Glebe Point Rd, Francis St, Derby Pl, Coweper St, Norton St and Mitchell St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee apply

properties.otherAdvice:
Backstreet Boys at Qudos Bank Arena on this evening. Start from 7.30pm and finishing by approx 10.30pm tonight.

Significant delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct. Fans are strongly urged to catch public transport to avoid the traffic delays.

CAR PARK UPDATE: All car parks in the precinct have may have sold out. If you haven't pre-booked you'll need to catch public transport as there will be no parking available on site. Consider parking at a nearby station commuter carpark and continuing your trip by train or bus to Olympic Park. If you have pre-booked follow directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney WorldPride Rainbow Republic will be the final event to close out the WorldPride festival kicking off from 3pm, finishing by 10pm.

With more than 20,000 people expected, traffic will be heavier than usual within the Sydney CBD including Macquarie St, College St and William St.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area. Roads will be closed within and outside the Domain to allow crowds to safely arrive and leave the event.

Road closures:

From 7pm to 11.30pm

  • Art Gallery Rd between Prince Albert Rd and Mrs Macquaries Rd, and Mrs Macquaries Rd.

From 9pm to 11.30pm

  • Cathedral St from St Mary’s Rd
  • College St between Park St and Prince Albert Rd (cycleway will also be closed)
  • Hospital Rd between Prince Albert Rd and Shakespeare Pl
  • Macquarie St between Hunter St and St James Rd 
  • Prince Albert Rd between Macquarie St and Hospital Rd
  • St James Rd between Elizabeth St and Macquarie St
  • St Mary’s Rd between Yurong Pkwy and Prince Albert Rd

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the Domain from 6pm to 11.30pm on College St, Hospital Rd, Hunter St, Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd, Shakespeare Pl, St James Rd and St Mary’s Rd. Clearways will also be in effect on the eastern side of Hospital Rd from 12pm midday to 11.30pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies

properties.headline: Oxford Street Party - Sydney WorldPride DARLINGHURST Oxford Street between College Street and Flinders Street
properties.publicTransport: Buses are diverting around Oxford St in both directions. Visit transportnsw.info for more details and to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney WorldPride's Oxford Street Party will see Oxford St closed to all vehicle traffic for a two-day street event on Saturday 4 and Sunday 5 March.

**Oxford St is now closed in both directions. Flinders St is closed northbound from Moore Park Rd to Oxford St**

Motorists are being diverted via Kings Cross or Surry Hills around Oxford St during the closure.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time as delays are expected on detour routes including Cleveland St, William St and Darlinghurst Rd.

Roads are closed from 12.01am Saturday 4 March until 4.30am Monday 6 March

  • Oxford St between College St and Flinders St
  • Flinders St northbound lanes from Moore Park Rd to Oxford St
  • Local side streets off Oxford and Flinders streets are closed.

Special event clearway parking restrictions are in effect from 12.01am Saturday 4 March until 4.30am Monday 6 March on Oxford St, Flinders St, Forbes St, Albion St, Crown St, Liverpool St, South Dowling St, Wentworth Ave and surrounding local roads.

Closures and clearways for Pride Villages on Riley St, Crown St and surrounding local roads remain in place until 4.30am Mon 6 March.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

  • Campbell Street between opposite #176 Campbell Street and Riley Street southern side
  • Crown Street between Oxford Street and Campbell Street both sides
  • Goulburn Street between Riley Street and Crown Street both sides
  • Riley Street between Lower Campbell Street and Campbell Street eastern side
  • Riley Street between Oxford Street and Goulburn Street both sides

 Notes:

1Authorised Doctors Vehicles Excepted parking (7am - 8pm, Mon - Fri) relocated to Albion Street southern side between Riley Street and Derby Lane.
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL Championship Series Game 3: Sydney Kings v New Zealand Breakers at Qudos Bank Arena. Start 7:15pm. Finish approx 9:40pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
Wests Tigers v Knights at Leichhardt Oval. Kick off from 4:05pm and full time around 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event.

Mary St may be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place.

Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Warriors at Allianz Stadium. NRL kick-off from 3pm and full-time around 4:30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the stadium. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave is partially closed outside the stadium from 1pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game. Access Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd.

Special event clearways are in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 1pm until 6pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra travel time as parking will be in high demand and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

NRL: Roosters v Rabbitohs at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off from 8:05pm and full-time around 10:05pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the stadium. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave is partially closed outside the stadium from 5:05pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game. Access Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd.

Special event clearways are in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

NRL: Knights v Dolphins at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick-off at 6pm and full-time around 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

A-League Men: Newcastle Jets v Perth Glory at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm and full-time around 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

NRL: Bulldogs v Wests Tigers at 4:05pm at Belmore Sports Ground. Finish 5:45pm (approx)

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Belmore Sports Ground as fans make their way to the game.

Parking is limited on local streets and car parks in the area. 

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

A-League: Macarthur FC v Melbourne City at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Start from 3pm, finish approx 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Parramatta Eels v Cronulla Sharks at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 6pm, finish around 7:45pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching and within Parramatta as 20,000 fans travel to the game during the busy Friday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Roads outside the stadium will close prior to full-time for up to an hour between 7.40pm and 8.40pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Fans should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. If you’re travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.
